intro: Andryala undulata, commonly known as the wavy Andryala, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
